is part in Assam and part in Arunachal Pradesh. It lies on Tezpur - Bomdila route ( 52 Km/32 mi from Tezpur and 100 Km/62 mi from Bomdila). All tourists visiting Arunachal Pradesh through Tezpur - Bomdila route have to show there ILP/PAP at the check post over here. The place remains highly under explored. Note that though lodges are available in Assam part of the town you will still need to have an ILP/PAP to visit other parts of town which belong to Arunachal pradesh.
From Tezpur, Taxis and Buses run till Bhalukpong. Any vehicle going to
from Tezpur will pass through Bhalukpong. Alternately one can come over to Balipara (20 km/12 mi from Tezpur) and catch the buses that ply on Itanagar-Bomdila route and get down at Bhalukpong.
Bhalukpong is a small town and can be covered on foot. Alternately you can hire one of the Taxis standing at Taxi stand just past the check post to take you around.

also known as Pakhui Wildlife Sanctuary and Pakhui Tiger reserve is a 862 sq. km. (332 sq mi) wildlife sanctuary. Tourists can either go on a day trip or even better can stay at one of the forest lodges for which booking should be made in advance. Note that tourism is not much developed in this area and even locals will not know much about getting inside the reserve. It is advisable to contact local forest office at either Bhalukpong or Seijosa for arranging night stay inside the  reserve well in advance.

There are multiple wine shops all over the town.
